Key Match Events: The Lakers couldn't slow down the Timberwolves offense
The Wolves' lights-out shooting was too much for the Lakers to try to contain
The Lakers got some strong production out of their top draft picks
Post-Match Reflections: The most important takeaway is that everybody came out of the game healthy as they ramp up for the start of the regular season
There were some positives to take away from this game, especially from their two top draft picks in Dalton Khnect and Bronny James
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers' hot third quarter allowed them to cut the Wolves' lead to as little as two
Dalton Khnect, who was one of the top scorers in college basketball last season, put that same scoring on full display in the Lakers' preseason opener
Bronny James recorded three of the team's 12 blocks, a figure that was a team-high for the second-round rookie
Others: Austin Reaves was the starter that got the most burn for Los Angeles, scoring 16 points, grabbing five rebounds, dishing seven assists, and recording a team-high three steals in 25 minutes played
Donte DiVincenzo played 10 minutes early on in the game and torched the Lakers, scoring 11 points while shooting a perfect 4-for-4 from the field (3-for-3 from three-point range)
Josh Minott was a pleasant surprise for Minnesota, as he scored 22 points while shooting 9-for-11 from the field and 4-for-6 from three
